attributes.comment:
My husband and I are in process of adopting from China. It is a certainty that
every family who has a dossier in China will experience the expiration of their
fingerprints (valid for 15 months) and I-171H/I-797C approval (valid for 18
months). The cost, both emotionally and financially of filing a new I-600A will
already be very high. For us this also means another 8 hour drive.

It has now been brought to our attention that USCIS has a proposal to raise some
of their fees. Not only is this frustrating to us as adopting parents but
discouraging as well. The costs to bring an unwanted orphan into this country
are already astronomical and now our own government is increasing this burden. I
ask that you please reconsider this proposal and consider the following proposal
instead:

1)Effective immediately, set the valid period for all newly issued
I-171H/I-797C from 18 to 24 months.
2)Effective immediately, allow all families holding a valid I-171H/I-797C to
file and be approved for an extension to 24 months within 30 days after
submitting the following documents:

a. A copy of their current I-171H/I-797C and valid fingerprints
b. A Home Study update to ensure that families still qualify to adopt from
China.

Thank you,
Valerie Flynn
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Valerie Flynn
